interface.name: kf5_taskbar
interface.description:
This interface manages application windows. It provides requests to show and hide the desktop and emits an event every time a window is created so that the client can use it to manage the window.
Only one client can bind this interface at a time.

request.name: show_desktop
request.description: Tell the compositor to reveal the desktop.

request.name: hide_desktop
request.description: Tell the compositor to restore windows exactly as it was before calling kf5_taskbar.show_desktop.

event.name: window_created

description.summary: notify the client that a window was mapped

event.description:
This event will be sent immediately after a window is mapped. A new kf5_window object is created and it will be used to manage this window.
Values for state argument are described by kf5_taskbar.window_flag. They are used in a bitfield.

interface.name: kf5_window
interface.description:
Manages and control an application window.
Only one client can bind this interface at a time.

request.name: set_state
request.description:
Set window state.
Values for state argument are described by kf5_taskbar.window_flags and can be used together in a bitfield.

request.name: set_workspace
request.description: Maps the window to a different workspace. If -1 is specified as workspace index, the window will be mapped on all workspaces.

event.name: title_changed
event.description: This event will be sent as soon as the window title is changed.

event.name: app_id_changed
event.description: This event will be sent as soon as the application identifier is changed.

event.name: state_changed
event.description:
This event will be sent as soon as the window state changes.
Values for state argument are described by kf5_taskbar.window_state.

event.name: workspace_changed

description.summary: window was moved to another workspace

event.description:
This event will be sent when a window is moved to another workspace or if it becomes visible on all workspaces.
A -1 workspace index means the window is visible on all workspaces.

event.name: unmapped
event.description: This event will be sent immediately after the window is closed and its surface is unmapped.
